page.title: Ingredients & Chemistry
page.subtitle: The pharmacological secrets of Piper methysticum: Kavalactones, chemotypes, and mechanisms of action.

uebersicht.paragraph1: The psychoactive effect of Kava is primarily produced by a group of compounds known as Kavalactones (or Kava Pyrones). Unlike many other psychoactive plants (such as coffee or tea), Kava does not contain alkaloids as its main active ingredients.
uebersicht.paragraph2: So far, 18 different Kavalactones have been identified, of which six are responsible for over 96% of the pharmacological effect. These six 'Major Kavalactones' form the basis for the classification and quality determination of Kava.

kavalactone.title: The 6 Main Kavalactones
kavalactone.intro: Each Kavalactone has a unique effect profile. The overall effect of a Kava strain results from the specific mixing ratio of these six components.

tableData.name: Yangonin
tableData.effect: Stimulating, acts on CB1 receptors (endocannabinoid system)

tableData.name: Kavain
tableData.effect: Anxiolytic (anxiety-relieving), mood-enhancing, mental focus. Responsible for the 'Heady' effect.

tableData.name: Dihydromethysticin
tableData.effect: Sedating, long-lasting. High concentrations can cause nausea (typical for Tudei Kava).

chemotypen.title: The Chemotype System
chemotypen.intro: To predict the effect of a Kava strain, a 6-digit code is used that lists the Kavalactones in descending order of their concentration. This is called the Chemotype.
chemotypen.exampleText: This means that Kavain (4) has the highest concentration, followed by Dihydrokavain (2), then Methysticin (6), and so on.
chemotypen.nobleTudeiIntro: The chemotype is the most important tool for distinguishing high-quality 'Noble Kava' (noble kava) from the inferior 'Tudei Kava' (two-day kava).
chemotypen.nobleDescription: Noble Kava: Chemotypes usually start with 4 (Kavain) or 2 (Dihydrokavain). This provides a pleasant, anxiety-relieving effect without a long 'hangover'.
chemotypen.tudeiDescription: Tudei Kava: Chemotypes often start with 5 (Dihydromethysticin) or 2 with a very high proportion of 5. DHM is broken down very slowly and can lead to days of fatigue and nausea.

synergien.title: Synergies & Entourage Effect
synergien.paragraph1: Similar to cannabis (terpenes & cannabinoids), the total extract of Kava is more effective than isolated Kavalactones. This is referred to as the entourage effect.
synergien.paragraph2: Isolated Kavain is anxiolytic, but the combination with Yangonin (MAO-B inhibition) and Desmethoxyyangonin (dopamine increase) significantly enhances the mood-lifting effect. Therefore, traditional preparations or full-spectrum extracts are preferred over isolated active ingredients.

weitere.title: Other Ingredients
weitere.intro: In addition to the Kavalactones, the root contains:

items.label: Flavokavins (A, B, C)
items.text: Chalcones with potential antitumor properties, but also suspected to be cytotoxic at extremely high doses (mainly in Tudei varieties).

items.label: Alkaloids
items.text: Pipermethystin is mainly found in the leaves and stems, not in the root. It is toxic and a main reason why traditionally only the roots are consumed.

items.label: Starch & Fiber
items.text: Make up about 43% of the dry mass and provide the typical consistency of the drink.
